description: And buggy as hell. I think I'll get a stroke.
summary: worst software I ever used in my life

description: Not sure if I could use it since I have an extensive experience with expensive CAD programs and I'm spoiled, but perhaps for a simple drawing of electrical diagram or small home refurbishment I can see it as very useful
summary: not bad for the size and license

description: Free free free
It is a great program I used it for many years but now seem to crash even before starting on Ubuntu 18.04 not sure if something wrong in my system or if other had this problem too?
Always crashing. Causes PC crashing.

It launches at least which is more than you can say of most programs available on the Software store.

However it throws out error messages when opening files. Therefore it's not really that useful if it cannot open saved files.
It is a great free app for people who needs one.
Takes a moment to get used to, but has many features and is capable of many things.
The only CAD I could afford, I have used Libricad almost daily for years. As a carpenter I have come to find it nearly indispensable. Big thank you to whoever maintains it and provides it free.

How to use instructions not easy to follow.
Works very well when learnt.
Not really intuitive and completely unusable with a trackpad
I appreciate the effort, but unable to do the basics like drag and enter custom sizing, makes this app awful. Just a waste of everyone's time I am afraid.

I've used LibreCAD for 2-3 years now and while simple it has always worked great and allowed me to do almost everything I needed. Recently, it has begun crashing after about 5 mins of working with no obvious reason...
It crashed when I tried to open dwg file
i'm don't used it. It crass
This is a nice an simple 2D drafting took. Easy to learn and use
Sorry west my time. Not work . Most of functions just not work ?!

Have used LibreCAD linux version off and on for 5 years. It is stuck in the version from 2016. Currently using this version. It has some bugs. The Microsoft windows OS version has been improved and fixed, and has a 2021 version. If you want to use this program, then using the MS version through Wine or such. It seems designed for parts design or the like. It is free and has many useful features. I recommend you study the libreCAD forums and learn how to use the program's features before attempting the drawing you want from it. Learning on the fly lead me to redoing the drawings many times. It is cumbersome for architectural drawings. Using hatching, blocks and dimensions create excess work because of bugs and strange behaviour. Sometimes blocks used in the drawing get frozen and cannot be edited. Depending on how you copy or insert the blocks they can create duplicate blocks in the block list, exploding the size of the file. Large files cannot be edited (somewhere over 8 or more MBs). Problematic for architectural blueprints with many views of the structure. Editing the block list is very cumbersome. Each layer has only one colour so boundary lines and hatches are the same colour. Hatching order you set reverts to original order when they are copied, particularly when drawings are inserted into another drawing. Sorry for the long story. This is just to say, it has good points, is stuck in an old version and you should learn how to use it before getting seriously into your drawing. I have used AutoCAD many years ago, so am familiar with some aspects of CAD.

Like so many (FOSS) efforts in the CAD/CAM space it might be good but has an enormously steep learning curve requiring the use of archane keyboard/text commands to do anything even vaguely accurately. I know drafting/design is a complex subject in it's own right (just because you have a CAD program doesnt mean you can design a building) but the tools should not get in the way or hinder the activity. There is a steep learning curve just to drive this software, nothing to do with the steep learnng curve of knowing how to design stuff.

This software is most definately not intuitive or easy to use.
summary: Steep learning curve, not intuitive or easy

description:
very good

bery good
This program has nothing on Autocad.
When an item is selected, there is no menu for editing the features of that item. When constructing features, there is no explanation of how to input information about those lines (EG length, radius)
summary: Unintuitive even for experienced CAD users

description:
First of all this doesn't work well in Gnome DE, so that's a bummer. Too many crashes and menus poping up where ever it feels like etc.

The main problem I had was with the commands. I wish the commands where a little bit more easier to execute. Space bar to execute command is finally here but doesn't work very well. For eg: delete function can't execute through spacebar.

The other thing is it can't open .dwg files which is a major drawback.

Overall can't recommend this for CAD works right now except for light weight hobby. Although I am hopefull that this will be usable along the way.

I'm a +20 yr. CAD user and unfortunately have had to go with proprietary software to draft in Linux. 
So many 2D drawing aids/tools are already there but the user interface is so far away from industry standards, it's feels like the application is resisting the user from drafting anything. This is not like a GIMP/Photoshop thing. If the developers would transfrom the user (and command line) interface to something closer to Autocad, it would be a real libre CAD alternative that could shift architects to GNU/Linux. Otherwise, it feels hopeless...
summary: Real drawback with the user interface

description:
When the name is LibreCAD? 

then to confirm, on their site it clearly states that it's GPLv2 right on the first page. Thumbs down to Ubuntu Software for that error, and thumbs up to LibreCAD for free open source CAD software.
summary: How does the Ubuntu Software store list this as proprietary?

description: Was trying to find a program to open DWG files and this didn't appear to be able to (Building Schematic from AutoCAD)
For some reason the toolbar icons are cutoff, to fix it just go to Edit -> Widgets and select style "Adwaita" (or the dark version)
summary: Great app but theme issue in fedora

description:
Half baked for now.
- Didn't find grid or unit snap.
- didn't find how to print 1:1 (1cm = 1 printed cm)
- no paper preview on the design layout
- no arc?
- undo messed up with command in my case
well ...
summary: didn't find how to print 1:1, no paper preview

description:
Have used this for some assignments, it lacks some features that autodesk has but paid products are paid for a reason.
The uni actually reccomended it as a free alternative.
Occasional stability issues when working with complex files (i.e. A1/A3 detail drawings with a lot of hatching going on) but could have just been the laptop I was using
The only good thing about LibreCAD is that it is a free software, but it is so inconvenient that I can't even use it. It is the worst CAD software I ever tried to use.
summary: Worst CAD software I ever used

description: Have been using for years. It is outstanding compared to manual drafting.

I have worked in heavy industrial engineering my whole life, doing new installations, development and commissioning of new equipment, some ’Mega-projects’. I have worked with mechanical, electrical, process drawings and cause and effect diagrams.
I read the documentation for an afternoon and at the end if it could not work out how to draw 2 lines at right angles to each other.

Wouldn't listen to 'Mega-Project' boy, the program is extremely easy to use. Took less than 2 minutes to draw 2 orthogonal lines. Increasing amazed at the number of high quality open source products available.
Amazing software given the circumstance, a drop-in replacement for AutoCAD and other paid software regarding any orthographic drawing work or even schematics, better than FreeCAD.
summary: Near Drop-In Replacement for Orthographic Drawings

description:
This is a very good CAD program for 2D drawings. Coming from AutoCAD it was very easy to get into and start doing what I wanted. Due to it being 2D only it will be a challenge to turn my drawings into 3D models later on, but by then I hope I have a student license for AutoCAD on my Windows PC!

I only gave it four stars due to lack of 3D drawing functionality, but it really should be 4.5 stars.

Leider hapert es an vielen Stellen. Als Beispiel ist es mir nicht möglich innerhalb eines Befehls ein Objekt auszuwählen. So lässt sich nunmal nicht arbeiten. Auch ist es zumal wenn man von Autocad kommt (Sehr flüssiges arbeiten ohne Schulung schnell erlernt) überhaupt nicht intuitiv. Wird sehr selten aktualisiert. Von mir noch keine Empfehlung. Leider!!!

Vielleicht liegt es daran, dass ich mit LibreCAD so gut zurechtkommen, dass ich keine Autocad-Erfahrung habe :-) Auf jeden Fall habe ich mit LibreCad eine Erntemaschine konstruiert die es am Markt nicht unter 80000 Euro gäbe. Die Dateien wurden an eine Firma zum Laserschnitt weitergegeben und auf Zehntelmillimeter genau zugeschnitten. Nicht ein einiges Problem gab es dabei. Zusammengeschweißt, Standardteile wie Lager, Kettenräder, Siebbänder, Rollen dazu. Gesamt 20000 Euro - 60000 Euro gespart.
summary: Ein rundum-glücklich Programm für CAD-Anfänger wie mich!

description: grundsätzlich brauchbares cad-programm. für mich als ehemalig professionellen acad-user anfangs schwer zu bedienen, gibt sich aber, da vieles an acad angelehnt. super layersteuerung, könnt sich acad was abschauen!
Für 2 Dimensionale Zeichnungen aller Art.

Ein CAD-Tool, das seinen Namen nicht verdient. Es funktioniert null intuitiv. Man kann die Länge von Linien nicht per Klick ändern. Bemaßungen werden nicht aktualisiert wenn sich das Bezugsobjekt ändert.
Hat alles an Board was die Teueren CAD Programme auch haben. Tut was es soll.
summary: Für ein Kostenloses CAD Programm ziemlich gut

description:
Für das Erstellen von 2D Skizzen und auch technischen Zeichnungen bestens geeignet. Ich kommen mittlerweile sehr gut damit zurecht und bin voll zufrieden.
Es sind auch isometrische Skizzen machbar.
summary: etwas Geduld und dann kommt das Aha-Erlebnis - sehr zu empfehlen!

description:
Leider nicht ganz so intuitiv wie ich es von anderen 2D CAD Freewareprogrammen (TurboCAD) gewohnt bin, zudem kann ich z.B. die Zeichnung auf A4 einrichten und dennoch beim Zoomen unendlich herauszoomen?? wo ist der Rand der Zeichnung? Dass man anschliessend beim Hereinzoomen auf der unendlich grossen Zeichenfläche seine Zeichnung nicht mehr findet ist naheliegend.
An meinem Labtop mit Touchpad lässt es sich so nicht arbeiten!
Muy completo, facil de utilizar y existe suficiente informacion en linea, y librerias para mejorar su desempeño.
Que mas se puede pedir para un software de diseño en 2D gratuito
la mejor herramienta
basica pero funcional

Muy buen programa CAD. Tiene mucho futuro.
Las herramientas son muy simples y efectivas.
Intento abrir un archivo de extensión .dwg y se reinicia, no logra levantar el archivo dando cerrando el programa y no informando cual es el error

Llevaba tiempo buscando algo similar.
Muy recomendable
Es una muy buena herramienta CAD, aunque diferente a Autocad en su manejo. Cumple con lo que se necesita en un CAD 2D.
Aplicación sencilla pero hay que investigar para saber manejarla. TRADUCIDA A MEDIAS. NO SE ACTUALIZA NUNCA, no se molestan en actualizarla, es como si estuviese abandonada.
Funciones muy buenas y facil de usar. Excelente
summary: Muy buena aplicacion para uso pyme-hoga

the menu is such user friendly and i can use it without problems

Buena aplicación para hacer dibujo técnico bidimensional
ta chido pa aprende en el insti uwu
He dibujado un gato y parece que tiene cancer de grado 3 pero no pasa nada La recomiendo 9/10. Muchas gracias.
He utilizado esta maravilla de app, para dibujar ciertas figuras abstractas las cuales parecen estar mas desfiguradas que la cara de ribery, no obstante, es recomendada al 100%
Es una aplicación que cuando sabes hacerla es muy facíl de utilizar, pero cuando estas aprendiendo es muy difiícil ya que es muy poco intuitiva.

Es una buena aplicación para realizar planos y programar con coordenadas en CNC. Se recomienda actualizar a la versión 2.2.0.2 con mejoras en el Keyboard Settings.la presentación de la pantalla y accesos rápidos (barra espaciadora) para el Free snap
La aplicación funciona muy buen ya llevo un tiempo usandala de forma diaria.
sûrement pas très adaptée à des gros projets.
très bien pour faire des plans professionnels
Demande certainement beaucoup de mémoire. Inutilisable sur mon PC

L'apprentissage est peu aisé parce qu'il n'y a pas de bon tuto mais la prise en main n'est pas si compliquée. ça m'a pris quelques semaines pour vraiment me familiariser avec la bête mais depuis 2 ans maintenant j'en suis vraiment satisfait.
summary: je l'utilise pour le boulot régulièrement

description: Je n'arrive pas à ouvrir quel *.dwg fichier que ce soit. En choisissant un fichier existant (reçu depuis un utilisateur AutoCad sous windows) j'ai d'abord un message "expérimental - fermez d'abord votre travail". Je clique alors sur OK et libreCAD ferme sans rien faire.
un tres bon soft de dessin 2d
Après une prise en main facile grace au tuto en pdf trouvés sur le net, je m'en sers quotidienement. Seul regret la version installée via Ubuntu est la 2.1.3 et non la 2.2.
Simple et très efficace !

Franchement, quand on vient d'autocad, ce n'est vraiment pas au niveau. Ergonomie, barres d'outils... je suis dessinateur industriel professionnel, je voulais tester une solution alternative, rien ne me va.
Après une prise en main un peu fastitueuse, on réalise des plans avec cotations, hachures, etc ... comparables aux versions pro.
C'est un logiciel 2D facile à prendre en main, intuitif.
Гадость неудобная и непродуманная
Отличная программа

Не слушайте тех, кто пишет плохое про это приложение. Это плохие люди, а LibreCAD очень удобная программа, только надо немного почитать руководство пользователя.
Устанавливайте и работайте!
Лучшее , что нашел

Не надо тут "фуфуфу". Отлично работает на компах, управляющих станками с чпу. Быстро можно накидать чертеж для той же плазмы и тут же запустить порезку.
п.с. Плохому инженеру и интерфейс не френдли )))

Интерфейс автокада. Все русифицировано.

Свободное приложение LibreCAD - закрывает 100% потребностей 90% конструкторов-строителей, которые сегодня рисуют в стандартном для отрасли Автокаде. Большинство используют CAD процентов на 10%, просто заменяя им кульман.
Для этой цели LibreCAD идеален. Он прост в освоении, не требует конской ежегодной оплаты и способен быть той самой "мне просто чтобы чертить"-программой, которая и нужна большинству.
Но есть серьёзная проблема. Стандарт отрасли - .DWG.
Зависает постоянно
При обновлении на Fedora 36 перестала работать штриховка, просто вылетает программа...
В Ubuntu 22.04 все норм, в Fedora 36 - баги. Размеры, штриховки - все криво. Нет совместимости даже по файлам, созданным в другой ОС linux
Самый отличный вариант, не хватает 3д
